a:s.a:s: /* * Library: IMMZD18SPolioBOPVPlusIPVLogic (IMMZ.D18.S.Polio.bOPV plus IPV schedule) * Schedule Table: Bivalent oral polio vaccine (bOPV) plus inactivated polio vaccine (IPV) schedule */ library IMMZD18SPolioBOPVPlusIPVLogic

def.name: First bOPV dose from the primary series was administered

a:t.name: complete
a:t.value: First bOPV dose from the primary series was administered

a:t.name: pseudocode
a:t.value: "Type of dose" = "Primary series" and "Type of poliovirus dose" = "bOPV") = 1

a:t.name: create
a:t.value: The preferred schedule is to administer the 3 doses of bOPV starting from the minimum age of 6 weeks, with at least a 4 week-interval between doses.

a:s.a:s: 'The preferred schedule is to administer the 3 doses of bOPV starting from the minimum age of 6 weeks, with at least a 4 week-interval between doses.'

operand.value: The preferred schedule is to administer the 3 doses of bOPV starting from the minimum age of 6 weeks, with at least a 4 week-interval between doses.

a:t.name: pseudocode
a:t.value: To be determined by Member States; however, there is no recommended overdue date and individuals are always eligible to be vaccinated.

Second IPV dose from the primary series was administered

a:t.name: pseudocode
a:t.value: "Date and time of vaccination" (where "Type of poliovirus dose" = "IPV") + 4 months

a:t.name: create
a:t.value: The first IPV dose should be administered from a minimum of 14 weeks of age (with the third dose of the diphtheria–tetanus–pertussis vaccine [DTP3] or pentavalent vaccine [penta3]), with the second IPV dose being given at least 4 months later (possibly coinciding with other vaccines administered at 9 months of age).

a:s.a:s: 'The first IPV dose should be administered from a minimum of 14 weeks of age (with the third dose of the diphtheria–tetanus–pertussis vaccine [DTP3] or pentavalent vaccine [penta3]), with the second IPV dose being given at least 4 months later (possibly coinciding with other vaccines administered at 9 months of age).'

operand.value: The first IPV dose should be administered from a minimum of 14 weeks of age (with the third dose of the diphtheria–tetanus–pertussis vaccine [DTP3] or pentavalent vaccine [penta3]), with the second IPV dose being given at least 4 months later (possibly coinciding with other vaccines administered at 9 months of age).

a:t.name: pseudocode
a:t.value: To be determined by Member States; however, there is no recommended overdue date and individuals are always eligible to be vaccinated.
